Last month, native bird trappers have snared and caught the Luzon Buttonquail (Turnix worcesteri or Worcester's buttonquail) in Dalton Pass, a cold and wind-swept bird passageway in the Caraballo Mountains, in Nueva Vizcaya, located between Cordillera Central and Sierra Madre mountain ranges, in Northern Luzon. The rare species, previously known to birders only through drawings based on dead museum specimens collected several decades ago, was identified in a documentary filmed in the Philippines called Bye-Bye Birdie."
Question: Turnix worcesteri have yellow eyes True, False, or Neither?

How to build strength gradually
Choose the appropriate weight. When you're just starting out with exercise or you want to build your strength slowly, it's important to choose the appropriate weight. Too much or too little won't help you in the long-term. Question: Starting with the appropriate weight is the best option to build strength gradually. True, False, or Neither?

But when the WTO headquarters issue came up, and Germany made an offer and a pitch to get the WTO to be headquartered in Bonn, the Swiss suddenly realised they were vulnerable and began improving their offers.
Question: Swiss offered them Basel. True, False, or Neither?

How to cite an i statement
Cite the author's last name. In mla style, always use the author's last name in the in-text citation. This will help your reader to understand where your information came from. Question: Mla style takes years of practice to learn. True, False, or Neither?

New Zealand's Qualifications Authority said Friday that it still strongly discourages students from using anything other than full English, but that credit will be given if the answer "clearly shows the required understanding," even if it contains text-speak.
Question: New York's Qualifications Authority said Friday that it still strongly discourages students from using anything other than full English True, False, or Neither?

A Philadelphia police officer is in the hospital being treated for an injury he suffered while chasing a suspect.The officer suffered a puncture wound to his arm.He was injured while responding to a 911 call at around 3:30 a.m. Sunday for gunfire near 30th and Cumberland in the Strawberry Mansion section of the city.When the officer tried to question a man in connection with the gunfire, the man made a run for it.The officer chased him and fell to the ground when he heard gunfire.The man got away.Police found several shell casings at the scene.------
Question: The police officer was shot True, False, or Neither?

The Christian Democrats (CDU) won 35.2% of the vote, or 225 seats, against 34.3% for Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder's Social Democrats (SPD).
Question: The Christian Democrats are all white True, False, or Neither?

The School of Hotel Administration (SHA, more commonly known as the Hotel School) at Cornell University is a specialized business school in the SC Johnson College of Business at Cornell University, a private Ivy League university located in Ithaca, New York. Founded in 1922, it was the world's first four-year intercollegiate school devoted to hospitality management.
Question: The school is very competitive and tough to get accepted into True, False, or Neither?

The Norwegian Newspaper Corpus is a large and self-expanding corpus of Norwegian newspaper texts. The collection of this dynamic and continually growing corpus began in 1998.
Question: The Norwegian Newspaper Corpus is located in Minsk. True, False, or Neither?

How to write a weekly report
Identify the purpose of your report. While you may be required to submit weekly reports as part of your job duties, keeping your job is not the purpose for the report itself. Determining why your employer wants weekly reports will help you decide exactly what information should go into it, and which items are the most important. Question: In writing a weekly report, the employee should know its contents in order of importance. True, False, or Neither?

The federal government is talking about looking after home care, community services, strategies for youth, bursaries, pharmacare, ways to interest young people in science, a national school nutrition program, Canada wide benefits for poor children, a Canadian foundation for innovation, and a partridge in a pear tree.
Question: The federal government is not talking about bursaries. True, False, or Neither?

Stephan Lichtsteiner (born 16 January 1984) is a Swiss professional footballer who plays for Italian club Juventus and the Switzerland national team. An attacking right-back or wing-back, he is known for his energetic runs down the right wing, as well as his stamina and athleticism, which earned him the nicknames "Forrest Gump" and "The Swiss Express".
Question: Juventus was founded in 1899 True, False, or Neither?

The four-time world champion has established himself as one of the world’s greatest ever drivers since he broke onto the scene in 2007. But his outspoken character has often got him in trouble off the track, most recently with Max Verstappen. Hamilton’s former team-mate Jenson Button even said he was “weird” to work with. Rob Wilson – who has taught over half of the current F1 circuit how to drive faster – also believes there is something different about the Mercedes ace.
Question: Hamilton broke on to the scene prior to 2010. True, False, or Neither?

I hope very much, on the basis of this report and with the facts, we will be able to establish a healthy dialogue in the House to make sure the employment insurance system in Canada and the other programs built around it, to compliment it, continue to best serve Canadian citizens.
Question: The house does not discuss things amongst differing party memebers True, False, or Neither?

How to choose a dog fence for your yard
Check local fencing regulations. Your community may have laws about the materials and sizes allowed for residential fences. Don't rely on a fencing company to know the regulations. Question: Local fencing regulations in your community don't apply to dog fences for your yard. True, False, or Neither?

I thank the hon. member from the Conservative Party for bringing forward this motion so that at least there is some discussion in the House of Commons about what really is a most fundamental and important aspect of people's daily lives, the right to adequate, safe, affordable shelter and housing in Canada.
Question: The Conservative Party in Canada wants to discuss affordable housing in the house of commons. True, False, or Neither?

How to keep your phone cool in the car
Keep your phone on a vent mount with air conditioning on if you need to use it. If you need to use your phone while you're in your car, purchase a mount that attaches to one of the dashboard air vents. Turn on the air conditioner so it keeps your phone cold. Question: Your phone doesn't have to be hot in the car. True, False, or Neither?

Question: Mississippi has restaurant inspections for restaurants  True, False, or Neither?

How to decorate your door for winter
Hang a traditional christmas wreath. Wreaths are a winter-and christmas-decoration staple, and will look good on almost any front door. Tie a red ribbon or bow around your wreath to create an appealing visual contrast. Question: Wreaths will look good on almost any back door True, False, or Neither?

Hopscotch
All the girls were ready to start. They had spent a while making the hopscotch markings. They had used sidewalk chalk and ready to play. The girls began jumping to each numbered box. It was great fun playing hopscotch for them. Question: None of the girls were ready to start. True, False, or Neither?

Question: Factories will be hiring more  True, False, or Neither?

Question: Mail-boxes do not exist in this universe True, False, or Neither?

As much as I know about the scientific community -- and, you know, you have to remember that's not my discipline. But as much as I know about what the high school science standards say, it would be in standing with that. As far as the scientific community, I really can't go there, because I know that there is a lot more about Darwin than is in that textbook. I mean, I can absolutely say that without knowing everything about Darwin or knowing everything about science.
Question: The speaker is not a scientist. True, False, or Neither?

How to address envelopes with attn
Write " attn " followed by the name of the recipient. The " attn " line should always appear at the very top of your delivery address, just before the name of the person you're sending it to. Use a colon after " attn " to make it clearly readable. Question: The colon in the top line of the delivery address on an envelope, located after "attn," is used to make the line clearly readable. True, False, or Neither?

(WTNH) – An escaped Enfield prisoner has been caught in Georgia. 25-year-old Jerry Mercado escaped from the Carl Robinson Correctional Facility back on January 7. Mercado is a convicted burglar who was serving a state sentence at the Enfield facility. The US Marshal's office confirmed that he was captured on Wednesday. Officials were offering a cash reward of up to $2,500 for information leading to his arrest.
Question: Jerry Mercado went to McDonald's. True, False, or Neither?

The Trip
Henry was a banker on Wall Street. He made very good money and worked hard for it. A couple times a year, he took a vacation. His favorite vacations were the ones he spent sailing with his son. They loved spending time together more than anything else. Question: Henry went on vacation several times per year True, False, or Neither?

Question: darwin had a theory of evolution True, False, or Neither?

Speaking in the Russian Black Sea resort of Sochi on Monday, Mr Putin said the deal was "at the very least ill-considered and unprofessional because discussing such issues without the main supplier is simply not serious". Despite their bitter rivalry, Ukrainian President Viktor Yushchenko and Prime Minister Yulia Tymoshenko were both in Brussels for an international conference with the European Commission, the World Bank and other key lenders. The EU gets 80% of its gas supplies from Russia via a network of more than 13,000km (8,060 miles) of Ukrainian pipelines, some of which are 40 years old.
Question: The deal is far way from being agreed upon True, False, or Neither?

Lost Deal
Tim found a good deal at the store. Unfortunately he didn't have enough money on him. He tried to hide the item while he went home. He got more money and returned. The item had been taken by then. Question: The item was on a steep discount True, False, or Neither?

Question: The Canadian Foundation for Innovation is geared toward funding university research on health, the environment, science and engineering. True, False, or Neither?

Picnic Terror
Brad was on a picnic with his family. He had prepared several sandwiches and a pitcher of lemonade. Before they had a chance to eat, a large noise startled them. A bear had crept up behind them and was sniffing at the food. Brad and his family ran away and left the food for the bear. Question: brad forgot to bring anything to drink True, False, or Neither?

Mr. Speaker, so the member for Vaudreuil-Soulanges is very concerned that his own party could raise by 20% the number of Air Canada shares owned by a single shareholder, since, according to him, the Caisse de dpt et placement du Qubec could increase its holding of shares of this company to the point of taking control of it.
Question: This person is trying to raise shares owned by a single shareholder. True, False, or Neither?

Tue 10/10 @ 2:30PM Oberlin is the proud location of an iconic home by the legendary architect Frank Lloyd Wright, the Weltzheimer/Johnson House, completed in 1949. If you'd like to learn more about its design and how it came to be, come to the Tuesday Tea at Oberlin's Allen Memorial Art Museum. There Jill Greenwood, the museum's Nord Family Curator of Education, will share stories about the Weltzheimer family who commissioned the house. And yes, there will be tea and cookies after the presentation. It's free. oberlin.edu/amam/ Post categories:
Question: Frank Lloyd Wright will be at the event True, False, or Neither?

Christopher Sebastian "Chris" Buckley (9 November 1886 – 11 January 1973) was a footballer in the early years of professional football in England, who played at centre half for a variety of clubs including Aston Villa and Arsenal, before later returning to Villa as director and chairman. He was the younger brother of Frank Buckley, who was also a player and manager of Wolverhampton Wanderers.
Question: Buckley has scored at least one goal True, False, or Neither?

Elizabeth de Beauchamp Goudge FRSL (24 April 1900 – 1 April 1984) was an English author of novels, short stories and children's books as Elizabeth Goudge. She won the Carnegie Medal for British children's books in 1946 for "The Little White Horse". She was a best-selling author in both the UK and the US from the 1930s through the 1970s.
Question: Elizabeth de Beauchamp Goudge was named after a prized race horse True, False, or Neither?

The town of Watervliet ( or ) was a town that at its height encompassed most of present-day Albany County and most of the current town of Niskayuna in neighboring Schenectady County, in the state of New York, United States. Just prior to its dissolution, the town encompassed the current towns of Colonie and Green Island and the city of Watervliet.
Question: The current city of Watervliet is entirely in Albany County. True, False, or Neither?

How to file a complaint against a realtor in florida
Gather evidence that supports your complaint against the agent. The more documentation of misconduct or ineffectiveness you can provide, the more likely your complaint will be taken seriously. [substeps] Include copies of any supporting paperwork with your complaint. Question: Paperwork is not always the only form of evidence in court cases, video, audio and electronic evidence is all acceptable in realtor court as well but be mindful to present as little or as much as you can to ensure a swift, just case. True, False, or Neither?

In an effort to boost Uganda's economy, the government has been investing in the agricultural sector by helping farmers afford the farm inputs they need with vouchers and money subsidies. However, the current system often proves to be obsolete, resulting in farmers losing money or using the money for personal purposes or renouncing altogether to the subsidy when faced with the confusing voucher application process. Evelyn Namara, Founder and CEO of Vouch Digital joins CNBC Africa for more. Advertisement
Question: The Ugandan government is corrupt True, False, or Neither?

The owners of Phinda, the South African-based Conservation Corporation, could not have paid for a better advertisement for their philosophy of wildlife conservation: a people-based approach to conservation, which is slowly gaining ground in Africa as game reserves come under ever greater threat from hungry, poor and angry local populations.
Question: African populations want food. True, False, or Neither?

Washington Scientists have identified a hormone that significantly extends the lifespan of mice, a discovery that could mark a crucial step toward developing drugs that boost longevity in people.
Question: Washington scientists have already found the key to extending human life.  True, False, or Neither?

Alan Bergman (born September 11, 1925) and Marilyn Bergman (née Keith), born November 10, 1929) are American lyricists and songwriters. The pair have been married since 1958 and have written the music and lyrics for numerous celebrated television shows, films, and stage musicals. The Bergmans have won two Academy Awards for Best Original Song and have been inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.
Question: Alan and Marilyn Bergman worked well together. True, False, or Neither?

Lisa Jacobs is a British actress who is best known for playing Jewish diarist Anne Frank in the 1988 television film, "". She was nominated for the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Miniseries or a Movie for her role in this movie. The film also starred Mary Steenburgen as Miep Gies.
Question: Lisa Jacobs and Miep Gries became good friends will working on this film True, False, or Neither?

Crazy Sues, short for Specialized Unit, Enhanced Soldiers, are a fictional superhero team in the Marvel Comics universe. It first appeared in "All Winners Squad: Band of Heroes" #1 (July 2011), written by Paul Jenkins and illustrated by Carmine Di Giandomenico.
Question: Crazy Sues are female superheroes. True, False, or Neither?

Question: Canadian students are happy that education is paid for, but many are not satisfied with the level of education they receive. True, False, or Neither?
